p: Postharvest management of disease causing pathogens in fresh produce has been predominantly done by applying fungicides [ 5, 10]. The successful use of fungicides to reduce decay incidence has been highlighted for fruit types such as stone [ 11], apple [ 12], pear [ 13], mango [ 14] and many others. Moreover, the use of fungicides such as methyl 2-benzimidazole carbamate, thiabendazole and fludioxinil (FLU, Scholar Â®, Syngenta) to prevent decay has been widely reported in pomegranates and pome fruit [ 15, 16, 17].
